text:
A few reasons against it that I've seen:

- Signal already has a massive target on its back, adding payments adds a lot of needless complexity to the app that is a potential attack vector and risk to its main purpose: secure and private communications.
- Payments are incredibly regulated. Adding them to the app will very likely draw even more regulatory attention to the app.
- Why does a messenger app need payments in the first place? Why can't that be a separate app, or maybe a plugin? Is this something users have actually asked for?
- (This will vary regionally) Many people use Signal with their main phone number, so they're already not anonymous towards their contacts. That makes any kind of payment system a hard sell because it will lack all of the comfort and guarantees that come with well established payment systems like SEPA transactions, with no clear advantage. At least for the purpose of everyday payments between friends etc
